summary: This bill, the Donut Dollies Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to members of the Red Cross Supplemental Recreational Activities Overseas (SRAO) program, known as the Donut Dollies, who served honorably during the Vietnam War. The bill outlines the presentation process, design and striking of the medal, its disposition with the Smithsonian Institution, and the potential for duplicate bronze medals. It also emphasizes the importance of expediting medal production to honor the volunteers' service and sacrifice.
